laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased slightly to 1190 per cubic millimeter, with 86% neutrophils.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevated at 102.3 mg per liter (normal value, <3 mg per liter).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Tuberculosis Tests (IGRA and Tuberculin Skin Test)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for active Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection.
Mild papillary edema and neutrophil-predominant interstitial dermatitis; no indications of leukemia cutis.
Negative for Mycobacterium species initially; subsequently positive for pan-sensitive M. tuberculosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Negative at first, became positive during the second hospitalization.
